newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia govt beats parliament on soccer field.
newsitem.headline: Russia govt beats parliament on soccer field.

text.p: Russia's government, often at loggerheads with the communist-dominated parliament, has scored a victory over the legislature not in the political arena but on the soccer pitch.

On the eve of a crucial vote in the State Duma lower house of parliament on the cabinet's planned spending cuts, the government soccer team beat parliament's squad on Thursday night 2-0, Interfax news agency said.

Interfax did not say which ministers scored and gave no team line-up but it quoted one ministerial team member as joking that the fate of the government's spending cuts had rested on the outcome of the match.
The Duma is angry about the proposed cuts, which will slash government spending by a fifth following a big shortfall in tax revenues. The vote is expected to be held later on Friday.
The Russian government, President Boris Yeltsin's administration, the parliament and the Moscow mayor's office often hold soccer, tennis and volleyball matches.
Yeltsin, himself a keen tennis player, had to abstain from this year's Grand Hat tennis tournament, where the winner plays the president, as he was recovering from a heart bypass operation.
